thread.title: Why Miners Keep Expanding as Prices Collapse
thread.title_full: Why Miners Keep Expanding as Prices Collapse - WSJ

author: Paul Kiernan
title: Why Miners Keep Expanding as Prices Collapse
text:
RIO DE JANEIRO—Even as iron ore prices have collapsed, Brazilian giant Vale SA is building a $16 billion iron-ore operation that it touts as “the biggest project in our history and in international mining.”
How? Because its costs are collapsing as well.
From South America to Australia, plunging currencies in mineral-rich nations are... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
